Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: Courts of Heaven
programme.desc: Author and speaker Robert Henderson seeks to discipline the nations, bring people to their destiny, and shares the truth about how to take hold of the victory available through Jesus Christ.

programme.title: Today with J John
programme.desc: Canon J John of the Philo Trust gives viewers `a faith lift' and infuses faith, hope and love in his personal message direct from his home.

programme.title: David Jeremiah
programme.desc: Dr David Jeremiah of Turning Point Broadcast Ministries and Shadow Mountain Church has a passion for people and a clear mission: delivering the unchanging Word of God to an ever-changing world.

programme.title: Creflo Dollar
programme.desc: Dr. Creflo Dollar ministers to all walks of life with hope for change. With a renewal of faith, mind, and spirit, He and his wife Taffi share their vision for all to understand God's love and promises.

programme.title: Believer's Walk of Faith
programme.desc: Bill Winston of Living Word Christian Centre invites viewers to go deeper on their faith journey. His ministry is a solution-seeking outreach that embraces the Bible as the basis of existence.

programme.title: Andrew Wommack: Gospel Truth
programme.desc: Teaching on God's unconditional love and grace from the founder of Andrew Womack Ministries and Charis Bible College in Colorado.

programme.title: Joyce Meyer Enjoying Everyday Life
programme.desc: Joyce Meyer, author and one of the world's leading Bible teachers, gives encouragement and advice to help people enjoy daily life.

programme.title: Joseph Prince
programme.desc: Joseph Prince, the pastor of Singapore's New Creation Church, offers spiritual guidance based on Bible teachings to foster a closer connection between the Almighty and His followers.

programme.title: Sid Roth's It's Supernatural!
programme.desc: Messianic investigator Sid Roth discusses and examines the supernatural reality and power of God, and includes testimonies from those who have experienced extraordinary healings, miracles, and personal encounters with God.

programme.title: Dudley Rutherford
programme.desc: Pastor Dudley Rutherford of Shepherd Church seeks to lift up the name of Jesus via steadfast Biblical teaching.

programme.title: Discovering the Jewish Jesus
programme.desc: Messianic Rabbi KA Schneider looks at how the Old and New Testaments are integrated, building faith and changing lives.

programme.title: David Hathaway
programme.desc: David Hathaway has been preaching the gospel throughout Russia, Europe and Israel for over 70 years. He has seen the power of God from the beginning of his ministry, and wants to keep the fire going.

programme.title: Rick Renner
programme.desc: Renowned Christian scholar Rick Renner delves into the Greek New Testament, blending historical texts with modern illustrations to unpack God's message for His believers.

programme.title: Know the Cause with Doug Kaufmann
programme.desc: Doug Kaufmann looks at symptoms behind illness and allergies and suggests healthy, healing approaches. With scientific input from top health professionals who discuss diet, exercise and supplements.

programme.title: Passion Week - ICEJ
programme.desc: In the first day of Passion Week, Pastor Avraham Ben Hod and Dr Juergen Buehler retrace Jesus' footsteps after His triumphant entry into Jerusalem and the symbolism of the fig tree.

programme.title: Have you got a minute?
programme.desc: A God TV update on all the lastest developments in the ministry, across the globe with viewer's input, testimonies and encouragement, highlighting what it means to be a media missionary.

programme.title: Coffee with Andi (S2 E3)
programme.desc: Andi Andrews hosts this series of informal and open discussion shows with her friends, peers and co workers, covering all manner of topics across their walks of faith.

programme.title: CfAN TV
programme.desc: The CEO of Christ for all Nations (CfaN) Daniel Kolenda shares a challenging word, drawing from his experiences on the mission field, where CfaN has received over 75 million decision cards for Christ.

programme.title: Jewish Voice with Jonathan Bernis
programme.desc: Rabbi Jonathan Bernis of Jewish Voice Ministries shares the lessons he learned after his miraculous health recovery.

programme.title: 700 Club Interactive
programme.desc: 700 Club Interactive is dedicated to prayer, uplifting stories, positive Christian news, encouragement and community. Produced by CBN and hosted by Gordon Robertson and Terry Meeuwsen.

programme.title: Hagee Ministries
programme.desc: Pastors John and Matt Hagee of Hagee Ministries in San Antonio, TX, deliver messages from God's Word, proclaiming the bold truth of His promises.

programme.title: Allen Jackson Ministries
programme.desc: Pastor Allen Jackson brings a Biblical perspective to the ever-changing world, encouraging believers to lead with their faith in every arena - no matter what shaking the season may bring.

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: "The 700 Club," which first broadcast in 1966, is a newsmagazine featuring guests, news, music, testimonies and spiritual stories from a Christian perspective. News stories are frequently related to Bible passages or deal with Christian lifestyle issues. Hosts of the long-running religious show include televangelist (and former candidate for the Republican presidential nomination) Pat Robertson, Terry Meeuwsen and Gordon Robertson, son of Pat. News items of interest are delivered by anchor John Jessup.

programme.title: It Is Written
programme.desc: "It Is Written" has been a staple on American television since premiering in 1956. The weekly program, currently hosted by John Bradshaw, applies timeless truths to everyday life, with many episodes dealing with issues such as loneliness, fear, low self-esteem and spiritual principles. With its straightforward, uplifting presentations, the program aims to inspire and encourage people of all faiths and creeds. Founded by George Vandeman, "It Is Written" was the first religious telecast to air in color.

programme.title: 3ABN Sabbath School Panel
programme.desc: In this week's study, we consider the Samaritans. Who were they? Why was the relation between Jews and Samaritans so contentious? Though commerce between the two nations continued, other interactions were taboo. The Jews would not borrow from Samaritans or even receive a favor from them. Within this context, John shares the encounters between Jesus, the woman by the well, and the people of the Samaritan city of Sychar.

programme.title: It Is Written
programme.desc: "It Is Written" has been a staple on American television since premiering in 1956. The weekly program, currently hosted by John Bradshaw, applies timeless truths to everyday life, with many episodes dealing with issues such as loneliness, fear, low self-esteem and spiritual principles. With its straightforward, uplifting presentations, the program aims to inspire and encourage people of all faiths and creeds. Founded by George Vandeman, "It Is Written" was the first religious telecast to air in color.

programme.desc: Lonnie Melashenko.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E21 'Til Death Do Us Part Part 1 The Kid and Lou's special day is approaching, and the riders prepare for the couple's upcoming wedding. Teaspoon is upset over when the Army arrives in Rock Creek to recruit young men as scouts. Meanwhile, the townspeople brace for the Civil War.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E22 'Til Death Do Us Part Part 2 The Kid and Lou's wedding day arrives. The advancement of the Civil War forces the riders to take sides. Jesse must choose between his brother Frank or his friends in the Pony Express. An encounter with renegade rebels ends in tragedy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E13 The Coward George Collins, a meek young man who loves to write, moves west for adventure. However, he is soon fired as a trail cook and beaten up by trailhands. Lucas takes George under his wing to help him discover his true qualities and inner strength.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E14 Surveyors Mark overhears men plotting to rob the North Fork Bank while at a surveying camp and tells Lucas about what he heard. When Lucas questions his story, Mark runs away from home. Lucas later learns Mark was telling the truth and helps capture the men.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E6 The Travelers The murder of a US Marshal forces Cheyenne to bring back the outlaw wanted for the crime. However, Cheyenne doesn't believe the man is guilty. On his way back with the fugitive, the father of the victim is hot on his trail.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E10 Willie Kennard Makes His Mark in History Under siege by gunslingers, the gold mining town of Yankee Hill runs a newspaper advertisement to find a new marshal. Former slave and Union soldier Willie Kennard answers the ad, but he faces prejudice and doubt as he works to restore law and order.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E11 John Wesley Hardin: Killer on the Texas Frontier When outlaw John Wesley Hardin murders a sheriff, a hard-charging Texas Ranger joins forces with a cool-headed police detective to hunt the killer. The unlikely duo must learn how to work together to end Hardin's reign of terror once and for all.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E6 Tom Fitzpatrick: Trapper, Trader, Legend Although from humble beginnings, Tom Fitzpatrick is ambitious and intelligent. When he joins up with William Ashley's trapping expedition, he proves himself to be an invaluable member of the company, both as a hardy frontiersman and a shrewd businessman. Along with legendary mountain man Jedediah Smith, Fitzpatrick rediscovers the South Pass through the Rocky Mountains, opening the pathway that will enable western expansion for decades to come. Fitzpatrick quickly rises to the top of the fur trade and eventually takes over the company he once worked for, but he nearly loses everything when he takes a wrong turn while leading a supply train. Alone in the wilderness, he finds himself in a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with a band of Gros Ventre warriors. Somehow, Fitzpatrick must survive the harrowing trek back to safety without a horse, gun, or supplies.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E3 Dead Ringer A gunman impersonating Jimmy as Wild Bill Hickok, robs banks in the territory. Jimmy goes undercover to find out who is framing him. To catch the gunman in the act, the riders position themselves at the next bank that he plans to rob.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E4 Blood Moon A cholera outbreak spreads fear among the townspeople of Sweetwater. They blame a defenseless, mentally disabled boy named Danny, who traveled to town with a medicine show. Now, the riders must protect him from an angry mob of citizens.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Sister Rebecca Snipe returns to North Fork after an extended visit. Lucas' son Mark is smitten and plans to play matchmaker for his dad. However, the Snipe brothers get involved to make sure Lucas is good enough for Rebecca.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E10 New Orleans Menace Wealthy Frenchman Cesar Tiffauges, who is used to getting whatever he desires, wants to buy the McCain Ranch. Tiffauges, a sadistic man, abuses his followers regularly with beatings. When Lucas refuses, his son Mark becomes the object of cruelty.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E11 The Apprentice Sheriff Dan Willard fills in as deputy while Marshal Micah Torrance is away on business. Meanwhile, Texas cowhands come to town looking for fun and relaxation. When Dan tries to prove that his toughness, those actions backfire.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E12 The Angry Gun Lucas and Mark, returning after selling their herd, share the stagecoach trip with a marshal and his prisoner, Johnny Cotton. Johnny's gang stops and robs the stagecoach, while Johnny steals Lucas' gun and profits. Lucas is forced to track him down.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S4 E11 Home Is the Brave Cheyenne returns the body of war hero Cole Prescott to his hometown of White River for a proper burial. However, when Cheyenne arrives, instead of a warm welcome, the townspeople greet him with hate towards the dead man.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E1 The Long Rope Cheyenne returns to his hometown as Sheriff Bodie. He is seeking a murderer in a town filled with corruption. Being home brings back many memories, including an old feud and a man who organized a lynching when he was a child.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Kid The Kid becomes part of a group of six Pony Express riders in the Old West based at the Sweetwater Station in the Nebraska territory. He meets station master, Teaspoon Hunter, and fellow riders, Buck, Jimmy, Ike, Cody and Lou.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E2 Gunfighter Childhood memories are torturing Jimmy. When he accidentally spooks a horse, the man riding it is insulted. The man, Longley, is a hired gun and demands an apology. Teaspoon tries to help Jimmy with his issues, but he decides to fight the man.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E1 Day of the Hunter A famous old frontiersman, with a reputation as the best rifleman around, challenges Luke to see who's really the best with a rifle.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E2 Mail Order Groom A mail-order husband arrives in North Fork, and finds not only a bride, but also harassment from two local troublemakers.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E7 Decision Cheyenne learns of an impending attack against a cavalry troop traveling through Indian territory. Going against the commanding officer's route, he leads a mutiny to avoid a certain massacre.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E5 Wong Fee Lee Stakes His Claim Chinese immigrant Wong Fee Lee joins a convoy of miners headed to Deadwood, where he hopes to strike gold and start a business. But when the Black Hills Bandits stand in their way, Wong must find the strength to lead his fellow prospectors in battle.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E9 Law Comes to No Man's Land Marshal Chris Madsen helps newly appointed judge John Buford bring law and order to Oklahoma's Panhandle in an area known as No Man's Land. After escorting a wagon train of prisoners to Beaver City, they set up their first courthouse inside a saloon.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E3 Jim Beckwourth: War Chief of the Crow When former slave Jim Beckwourth heads west to seek work as a trapper, he begins what will become one of the most eventful, heroic lives of all the mountain men. As a joke, one of Beckwourth's fellow trappers tells a group of Crow warriors that Beckwourth is a long-lost member of their tribe, and the adventure begins. Adopted by the Crow, Beckwourth joins them in a series of ferocious battles with other tribes, becomes a war chief, and falls in love with a fierce female warrior named Pine Leaf. He then uses his hard-won influence with the Crow to convince them to provide furs to the powerful American Fur Company. But an unexpected visit from legendary trapper and old friend Tom Fitzpatrick sets off a violent collision that forces Beckwourth to choose between the two worlds he loves.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E5 Pride and Prejudice Buck guides the cavalry to a Sioux camp to release hostages. They find the Sweetwater store owner's wife, Sally, and daughter, Jennifer, who the Sioux kidnapped years earlier. However, their reunion is not a happy one as complications arise.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E6 The Littlest Cowboy Ike struggles with his handicap and is bitter after being beaten by men who take advantage of him. But, when he meets Arthur, a terminally ill boy, his outlook begins to change. Despite his circumstances, Arthur has an undeniable lust for life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E13 The Young Englishman Lucas and Mark discover a young calf is missing and traces it to the nearby Ashford Ranch run by an Englishman. When Lucas accuses foreman Norv Waggoner of cattle rustling to build up his own herd, Norv plans retaliation.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E14 The Gaucho Curge Palmer is upset after Argentinian Juan Argentez bought a ranch he wanted. Palmer insults Argentez and his children, Nita and Manolo. Meanwhile, Manolo's anger over who is courting Nita gets him into trouble when her suitor is found dead.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E15 The Pet Lucas and Mark find out a pony they adopted after the owner was killed may have anthrax. Fears of an epidemic rise in town. Meanwhile, the killer comes to the McCain Ranch thinking that Lucas has valuable information.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E16 The Sheridan Story At the end of the Civil War, General Sheridan and his staff arrive at the McCain Ranch. Trouble begins when ex-confederate soldier and hired hand Frank Blandon confronts the general, who shot and wounded him in the war.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E2 Counterfeit Gun Cheyenne is guarding a gold shipment on a train. A gang robs the train and shoots a man dead. Before he passes away, the man names Cheyenne as the gang's leader. Cheyenne must clear his name.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E3 Road to Three Graves Cheyenne helps his friend Tuk deliver equipment across private property to a mine. However, they run into major problems when they encounter a detestable landowner who wants the equipment for himself.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Kid The Kid becomes part of a group of six Pony Express riders in the Old West based at the Sweetwater Station in the Nebraska territory. He meets station master, Teaspoon Hunter, and fellow riders, Buck, Jimmy, Ike, Cody and Lou.

programme.desc: S5 E2 Counterfeit Gun Cheyenne is guarding a gold shipment on a train. A gang robs the train and shoots a man dead. Before he passes away, the man names Cheyenne as the gang's leader. Cheyenne must clear his name.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E3 Road to Three Graves Cheyenne helps his friend Tuk deliver equipment across private property to a mine. However, they run into major problems when they encounter a detestable landowner who wants the equipment for himself.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E3 Home of the Brave After an Indian attack on settlers, Buck finds himself in the middle, torn between his loyalty to his Kiowa brother and his bond with Pony Express members. After the tribe captures Ike, Buck must prove that he is a real Indian at heart.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E4 Speak No Evil Ike witnesses a stagecoach massacre and turns the killer's leader over to the marshal. However, the gang kidnaps and threatens to kill one of the riders if Ike testifies. It is a race against time to serve justice and keep one of their own alive.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E15 A Case of Identity Aaron Wingate lost his wife and son in a river boat fire years ago. The boy was never found. Wingate hires two private detectives who come to North Fork and decide that Mark will fit the bill. Lucas must fight for custody.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E16 The Visitor A pretty young widow named Ann Dodd passes through North Fork on her way to claim her inheritance. She and Lucas are immediately attracted to each other, but danger awaits as other heirs try to take Ann's life to get the inheritance for themselves.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Storm Riders The hired hand of a wealthy landowner ambushes and injures Cheyenne while he drives a herd of horses for a local rancher, on what he thought was open territory. As his boss nurses him back to health, Cheyenne gets more than he bargained for.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E12 The Battle of Stone Corral When bandits rob a train and gun down a pursuing marshal, they spark one of the largest manhunts in California history. After taking shelter behind the crumbling walls of Stone Corral, they make their final stand against a hail of gunfire.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Bandit Queen Once a feared gunfighter and sheriff, the legendary Bat Masterson is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story of Pearl Hart, the first woman to rob a stagecoach in the Old West. Masterson tracks down Pearl’s partner-in-crime, Joe Boot, who shares every daring and surprising detail from his wild days with the notorious “Bandit Queen.” In a time when outlaws and gunslingers captured the fascination of the American public, Pearl Hart was living proof that in the Wild West a woman could be just as infamous as a man.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E5 Kit Carson: The Greatest Scout in the West As a fur trapper, hunter, scout, and explorer, Kit Carson is an irresistible subject for reporters and novelists, and his incredible adventures make him a mythic figure in his own lifetime. Yet fame is the last thing on Carson's mind in 1849. All he wants to do is settle down to a quiet life with his wife on the family ranch, but once again fate comes calling. When settler Ann White is captured by an Apache raiding party, the Army seeks out Carson to help track the warriors and rescue Mrs. White, whose husband was killed in the raid. Although known to be the best tracker in the history of the Western Frontier, Carson admits this is the most difficult trail he has ever followed. He leads the military on a desperate chase, tracking the Apache through 200 miles of treacherous western wilderness. When they finally catch up with the Apache, the aftermath leaves Carson haunted for the rest of his days.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E7 Blood Money The Kid captures a murder suspect and brings him back to town. However, suspicions arise when the man hangs himself while in the custody of a corrupt marshal. The riders and family of the dead man are determined to find out the truth.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E8 Requiem for a Hero Cody meets his Western idol, Hezekiah Horn, a writer who is disgusted with the violence of the Indian police and the development of the West. Meanwhile, an unfortunate chain of events creates tragedy for Horn and his son.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E17 The Retired Gun Wes Carney, a famous gunfighter, and his new wife Clair move to North Fork. They open a store and settle down. However, three outlaws come to town to challenge him. Carney refuses and they ransack his store, forcing him to put his gunbelt back on.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E18 The Photographer Abel Goss is doing a portrait of Mark standing on a North Fork street. Suddenly he sees Colonel Whiteside and his sidekick, Jamison. When he recognizes them as the cruel men who tortured him in a Civil War prison camp, problems soon arise.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E19 Shivaree A young couple traveling to Yuma to get married come across Aaron Pelser's wagon train. Pelser and his group take things too far by forcing them to marry in North Fork, which is not the friendly spirit for a shivaree. Lucas steps in to help.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E20 The Deadeye Kid After witnessing a murder, 16 year-old Donnel O'Mahoney panics and comes to the McCain Ranch. A posse is on the hunt for the young man, believing he commited the crime. Mark befriends and hides O'Mahoney, who is traveling west from New York.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E4 Two Trails to Santa Fe Cheyenne helps an Apache woman escape torture from her tribe. He transports her to Santa Fe. However, angry Apaches retaliate and attack a settlement. The pair also encounters gold-hungry prospectors along the way.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E5 Savage Breed Cheyenne is guiding a buffalo hunting party that Marshal Lestrade is leading. Lestrade's daughter Lily and Senator Carr are in the group. Cheyenne finds a herd, but a mysterious gunshot sends the buffalo on a stampede. Cheyenne is suspicious.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E3 Home of the Brave After an Indian attack on settlers, Buck finds himself in the middle, torn between his loyalty to his Kiowa brother and his bond with Pony Express members. After the tribe captures Ike, Buck must prove that he is a real Indian at heart.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E4 Speak No Evil Ike witnesses a stagecoach massacre and turns the killer's leader over to the marshal. However, the gang kidnaps and threatens to kill one of the riders if Ike testifies. It is a race against time to serve justice and keep one of their own alive.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E15 A Case of Identity Aaron Wingate lost his wife and son in a river boat fire years ago. The boy was never found. Wingate hires two private detectives who come to North Fork and decide that Mark will fit the bill. Lucas must fight for custody.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E16 The Visitor A pretty young widow named Ann Dodd passes through North Fork on her way to claim her inheritance. She and Lucas are immediately attracted to each other, but danger awaits as other heirs try to take Ann's life to get the inheritance for themselves.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Storm Riders The hired hand of a wealthy landowner ambushes and injures Cheyenne while he drives a herd of horses for a local rancher, on what he thought was open territory. As his boss nurses him back to health, Cheyenne gets more than he bargained for.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E12 The Battle of Stone Corral When bandits rob a train and gun down a pursuing marshal, they spark one of the largest manhunts in California history. After taking shelter behind the crumbling walls of Stone Corral, they make their final stand against a hail of gunfire.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Bandit Queen Once a feared gunfighter and sheriff, the legendary Bat Masterson is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story of Pearl Hart, the first woman to rob a stagecoach in the Old West. Masterson tracks down Pearl’s partner-in-crime, Joe Boot, who shares every daring and surprising detail from his wild days with the notorious “Bandit Queen.” In a time when outlaws and gunslingers captured the fascination of the American public, Pearl Hart was living proof that in the Wild West a woman could be just as infamous as a man.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E5 Kit Carson: The Greatest Scout in the West As a fur trapper, hunter, scout, and explorer, Kit Carson is an irresistible subject for reporters and novelists, and his incredible adventures make him a mythic figure in his own lifetime. Yet fame is the last thing on Carson's mind in 1849. All he wants to do is settle down to a quiet life with his wife on the family ranch, but once again fate comes calling. When settler Ann White is captured by an Apache raiding party, the Army seeks out Carson to help track the warriors and rescue Mrs. White, whose husband was killed in the raid. Although known to be the best tracker in the history of the Western Frontier, Carson admits this is the most difficult trail he has ever followed. He leads the military on a desperate chase, tracking the Apache through 200 miles of treacherous western wilderness. When they finally catch up with the Apache, the aftermath leaves Carson haunted for the rest of his days.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E7 Blood Money The Kid captures a murder suspect and brings him back to town. However, suspicions arise when the man hangs himself while in the custody of a corrupt marshal. The riders and family of the dead man are determined to find out the truth.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E8 Requiem for a Hero Cody meets his Western idol, Hezekiah Horn, a writer who is disgusted with the violence of the Indian police and the development of the West. Meanwhile, an unfortunate chain of events creates tragedy for Horn and his son.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E17 The Retired Gun Wes Carney, a famous gunfighter, and his new wife Clair move to North Fork. They open a store and settle down. However, three outlaws come to town to challenge him. Carney refuses and they ransack his store, forcing him to put his gunbelt back on.

programme.title: Far Haven
programme.desc: In 1887, Hunter Braddock moves back to Far Haven, Arizona to start over with his two young children, but when his father-in-law is brutally attacked he must take on the corrupt forces strangling the town in order to protect what he loves most.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E17 Hero While hunting, Colly Vane encounters a dangerous outlaw, The Domino Kid, who forces Vane to shoot him. When he brings the body back to town, it's discovered he was shot in the back. Instead of being a hero, Vane faces danger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E18 The Horse Traders Kansas Sawyer is Lucas' friend who was cheated in a horse-trading deal. Lucas investigates Colonel Bourbon's operation and discovers his illegal process. He also learns that the horse Sawyer bought was stolen and is being sought after by outlaws.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Dalton Gang Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story behind the most brazen bank robbery of the Old West. Masterson tracks down the sole survivor of the Dalton Gang, who relives the horrible day when they attempted to rob two banks at the same time. The youngest of the Dalton brothers, Emmett Dalton describes how the gang was gunned down as they tried to make their getaway. Despite numerous gunshot wounds, Emmett lived to serve his time in prison and renounce his life of crime.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Great Train Robbery Bat Masterson, former gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the story behind one of the country’s greatest train robberies. Although Butch and Sundance are long gone, Masterson tracks down Sundance’s former girlfriend, Etta Place, to draw out more details. To pull off the audacious robbery, they used official Union Pacific lanterns to signal the train and fool the engineer into believing a bridge was out. As Etta reluctantly relives the events of the robbery and its aftermath, it’s obvious that she is still smitten by Sundance after all of these years.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S2 E8 William Sublette: King of the Fur Trade In his quest to become king of the fur trade, William Sublette revolutionizes the industry and puts his life on the line in the process. But he may risk too much when he rushes to save his comrades in the largest battle of the mountain man era.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E9 Bad Company Jimmy accidentally kills an innocent woman during a gunfight. Full of guilt, he goes to a lawless town, thinking that is where he should reside. The riders go after him to convince him that he doesn't belong there.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E11 The Play's the Thing Cody joins a troupe of traveling actors, unaware that the group's members are Confederates who are plotting to assassinate U.S. General Fremont. When the riders discover the truth, they ride to Fort Laramie to save Fremont from getting murdered.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark and a friend are trapped in an old mine.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: After many disappearances, Wooster takes charge and leads the train southward.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: Adams rescues a man staked and left to die in the desert.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Matt and Chester find a crippled man near death on the prairie and rescue him.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Several homesteaders are gunned down at the doors of their remote cabins by a mysterious slayer.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: An injured marshal, transporting a prisoner to court to testify, is forced to seek help at the Sherman ranch, where they are surrounded by gang members who want to prevent the prisoner's testimony.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: A friendly pickpocket helps Hardie bring thieves to justice after they rob his train.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: A new school teacher -- also an ex-convict -- becomes suspected of murdering a Wells Fargo agent.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A widower loses custody of his daughter; he accepts a job as hangman to earn money to get her back.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: The townspeople ostracize a woman whose husband was acquitted of murder.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A mysterious, wealthy new woman in town competes for Kitty's business.

programme.title: Posse From Hell
programme.desc: A former gunfighter is deputized to hunt down a quartet of killers who've escaped from jail and taken a woman hostage.

programme.title: The Command
programme.desc: After Capt. Forsythe (Gregg Barton), the commanding officer of a cavalry troop, is killed in an attack, the new leader is Capt. Robert MacClaw (Guy Madison), a military doctor who has practically no field experience. With assistance from Sgt. Elliott (James Whitmore), MacClaw tries to lead his men to safety, using his ingenuity. But then they are ordered to guide a wagon train, containing the lovely Martha Cutting (Joan Weldon), among others, through dangerous American Indian territory.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: When the horses on the wagon train suddenly begin dying, Flint is sent to find a doctor and finds himself in a shootout with the man's son-in-law.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: While visiting Laramie, Daisy discovers a dead body on the floor down the hall from her hotel room, but she has trouble getting people to believe her when she identifies the killer.

programme.title: Campmeeting
programme.desc: With Dr. Mike Murdock.

programme.title: Campmeeting
programme.desc: With Perry Stone.

programme.title: Your Appointed Time
programme.desc: Join David Cerullo as he teaches on your appointed time and the feasts of the Lord. Be empowered to unlock His supernatural blessings and favor in your life today!

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is cursed by a renegade Indian with a reputation for witchcraft.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The North Fork stagecoach must stop at the McCain ranch because of a severe snowstorm.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Two cowhands submit Lucas' name to a matchmaker.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A former gunfighter becomes a doctor hoping to make up for his past.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A Chinese man and his son plan to settle in North Fork.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas subdues a gang of bandits singlehandedly.

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: John backs a competitor to an established freight hauler (Robert Clary) faking Indian attacks to raise prices.

programme.title: The Big Valley
programme.desc: Jarrod risks his life and friendship to save a Basque anarchist menaced by friend and foe alike.

programme.title: Ride a Crooked Trail
programme.desc: An outlaw (Audie Murphy) is taken for a U.S. marshal by a Creole woman (Gia Scala), a judge (Walter Matthau) and the rest of a river town.

programme.title: Buffalo Soldiers
programme.desc: At the end of the Civil War, Washington Wyatt (Danny Glover) is liberated from slavery and signs up as a sergeant in the first all African-American U.S. Army unit. Once assigned to the unit, Wyatt realizes that both his commanding officer (Tom Bower) and his colonel (Bob Gunton) are racists. Tensions rise when Wyatt arrests Capt. Draper (Robert Knott) and several other Texas Rangers, all of whom are white. Later, Wyatt and his fellow soldiers set out to capture a hostile Indian chief.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A young woman living outside of civilization is taken in by Matt at her dying father's request.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A convent-bred woman sees the good in a killer's son and decides to reform him.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Matt's foster brother, an ex-convict, is torn between family bonds and his gang of criminals.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Kitty and Quint are boycotted for aiding an injured Indian woman and her husband.

programme.title: A Distant Trumpet
programme.desc: A West Pointer (Troy Donahue) faces warring Indians and rival women (Suzanne Pleshette, Diane McBain) at an 1880s Arizona fort.

programme.title: Posse From Hell
programme.desc: A former gunfighter is deputized to hunt down a quartet of killers who've escaped from jail and taken a woman hostage.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A buffalo hunter tries to force Lucas into a gunfight.

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: Victoria offers jewelry as collateral so Manolito can invest with Buck in a silver mine, which turns out worthless.

programme.title: Where Do People Go When They Die?
programme.desc: People tell their stories about experiencing life after death and about the other side; experts try to explain what happens when people die.

programme.title: The Answer
programme.desc: Join Mark Rutland on "The Answer" to find the grace that god has waiting for you.

programme.title: Finding Hope
programme.desc: Four emotionally charged stories of people who went through tremendous suffering but, with God's amazing love and renewed strength, they emerged victorious.

programme.title: Mike Murdock - School of Wisdom
programme.desc: Biblical principles of wisdom that help individuals face life's successes.

programme.title: David Jeremiah
programme.desc: In this weekly program, Dr. David Jeremiah delivers practical messages to the congregation at the Shadow Mountain Community Church in San Diego. Also featured is music from the Shadow Mountain Community Church Choir and Orchestra, as well as performances by musical guests that have included Steve Green and Charles Billingsley. Men and women who have been impacted by the Turning Point ministry also share their stories with viewers. During the month of December, "Turning Point" usually features special Christmas programming.

programme.title: Amazing Facts With Doug Batchelor
programme.desc: Did Jesus really rise from the dead? Hear factual reasons why we can have confidence in the resurrection.

programme.title: Fauda
programme.desc: After retiring from the Israel Defense Force, Doron is working on a vineyard. He gets roped back into active duty, though, upon learning that an enemy who Doron thought his unit had killed is still alive and plans on attending his brother's wedding. Doron rejoins the IDF team with the intention of going under cover at the wedding, but the plan goes awry when the team's cover is blown. That sets into motion a chaotic chain of events and leads IDF into a manhunt to locate and kill the squad's target.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E21 'Til Death Do Us Part Part 1 The Kid and Lou's special day is approaching, and the riders prepare for the couple's upcoming wedding. Teaspoon is upset over when the Army arrives in Rock Creek to recruit young men as scouts. Meanwhile, the townspeople brace for the Civil War.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E22 'Til Death Do Us Part Part 2 The Kid and Lou's wedding day arrives. The advancement of the Civil War forces the riders to take sides. Jesse must choose between his brother Frank or his friends in the Pony Express. An encounter with renegade rebels ends in tragedy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E13 The Coward George Collins, a meek young man who loves to write, moves west for adventure. However, he is soon fired as a trail cook and beaten up by trailhands. Lucas takes George under his wing to help him discover his true qualities and inner strength.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E14 Surveyors Mark overhears men plotting to rob the North Fork Bank while at a surveying camp and tells Lucas about what he heard. When Lucas questions his story, Mark runs away from home. Lucas later learns Mark was telling the truth and helps capture the men.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E6 The Travelers The murder of a US Marshal forces Cheyenne to bring back the outlaw wanted for the crime. However, Cheyenne doesn't believe the man is guilty. On his way back with the fugitive, the father of the victim is hot on his trail.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E10 Willie Kennard Makes His Mark in History Under siege by gunslingers, the gold mining town of Yankee Hill runs a newspaper advertisement to find a new marshal. Former slave and Union soldier Willie Kennard answers the ad, but he faces prejudice and doubt as he works to restore law and order.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E11 John Wesley Hardin: Killer on the Texas Frontier When outlaw John Wesley Hardin murders a sheriff, a hard-charging Texas Ranger joins forces with a cool-headed police detective to hunt the killer. The unlikely duo must learn how to work together to end Hardin's reign of terror once and for all.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E6 Tom Fitzpatrick: Trapper, Trader, Legend Although from humble beginnings, Tom Fitzpatrick is ambitious and intelligent. When he joins up with William Ashley's trapping expedition, he proves himself to be an invaluable member of the company, both as a hardy frontiersman and a shrewd businessman. Along with legendary mountain man Jedediah Smith, Fitzpatrick rediscovers the South Pass through the Rocky Mountains, opening the pathway that will enable western expansion for decades to come. Fitzpatrick quickly rises to the top of the fur trade and eventually takes over the company he once worked for, but he nearly loses everything when he takes a wrong turn while leading a supply train. Alone in the wilderness, he finds himself in a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with a band of Gros Ventre warriors. Somehow, Fitzpatrick must survive the harrowing trek back to safety without a horse, gun, or supplies.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E3 Dead Ringer A gunman impersonating Jimmy as Wild Bill Hickok, robs banks in the territory. Jimmy goes undercover to find out who is framing him. To catch the gunman in the act, the riders position themselves at the next bank that he plans to rob.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E4 Blood Moon A cholera outbreak spreads fear among the townspeople of Sweetwater. They blame a defenseless, mentally disabled boy named Danny, who traveled to town with a medicine show. Now, the riders must protect him from an angry mob of citizens.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Sister Rebecca Snipe returns to North Fork after an extended visit. Lucas' son Mark is smitten and plans to play matchmaker for his dad. However, the Snipe brothers get involved to make sure Lucas is good enough for Rebecca.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E10 New Orleans Menace Wealthy Frenchman Cesar Tiffauges, who is used to getting whatever he desires, wants to buy the McCain Ranch. Tiffauges, a sadistic man, abuses his followers regularly with beatings. When Lucas refuses, his son Mark becomes the object of cruelty.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E11 The Apprentice Sheriff Dan Willard fills in as deputy while Marshal Micah Torrance is away on business. Meanwhile, Texas cowhands come to town looking for fun and relaxation. When Dan tries to prove that his toughness, those actions backfire.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E12 The Angry Gun Lucas and Mark, returning after selling their herd, share the stagecoach trip with a marshal and his prisoner, Johnny Cotton. Johnny's gang stops and robs the stagecoach, while Johnny steals Lucas' gun and profits. Lucas is forced to track him down.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S4 E11 Home Is the Brave Cheyenne returns the body of war hero Cole Prescott to his hometown of White River for a proper burial. However, when Cheyenne arrives, instead of a warm welcome, the townspeople greet him with hate towards the dead man.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E1 The Long Rope Cheyenne returns to his hometown as Sheriff Bodie. He is seeking a murderer in a town filled with corruption. Being home brings back many memories, including an old feud and a man who organized a lynching when he was a child.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Kid The Kid becomes part of a group of six Pony Express riders in the Old West based at the Sweetwater Station in the Nebraska territory. He meets station master, Teaspoon Hunter, and fellow riders, Buck, Jimmy, Ike, Cody and Lou.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E2 Gunfighter Childhood memories are torturing Jimmy. When he accidentally spooks a horse, the man riding it is insulted. The man, Longley, is a hired gun and demands an apology. Teaspoon tries to help Jimmy with his issues, but he decides to fight the man.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E1 Day of the Hunter A famous old frontiersman, with a reputation as the best rifleman around, challenges Luke to see who's really the best with a rifle.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E2 Mail Order Groom A mail-order husband arrives in North Fork, and finds not only a bride, but also harassment from two local troublemakers.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E7 Decision Cheyenne learns of an impending attack against a cavalry troop traveling through Indian territory. Going against the commanding officer's route, he leads a mutiny to avoid a certain massacre.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E5 Wong Fee Lee Stakes His Claim Chinese immigrant Wong Fee Lee joins a convoy of miners headed to Deadwood, where he hopes to strike gold and start a business. But when the Black Hills Bandits stand in their way, Wong must find the strength to lead his fellow prospectors in battle.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E9 Law Comes to No Man's Land Marshal Chris Madsen helps newly appointed judge John Buford bring law and order to Oklahoma's Panhandle in an area known as No Man's Land. After escorting a wagon train of prisoners to Beaver City, they set up their first courthouse inside a saloon.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E3 Jim Beckwourth: War Chief of the Crow When former slave Jim Beckwourth heads west to seek work as a trapper, he begins what will become one of the most eventful, heroic lives of all the mountain men. As a joke, one of Beckwourth's fellow trappers tells a group of Crow warriors that Beckwourth is a long-lost member of their tribe, and the adventure begins. Adopted by the Crow, Beckwourth joins them in a series of ferocious battles with other tribes, becomes a war chief, and falls in love with a fierce female warrior named Pine Leaf. He then uses his hard-won influence with the Crow to convince them to provide furs to the powerful American Fur Company. But an unexpected visit from legendary trapper and old friend Tom Fitzpatrick sets off a violent collision that forces Beckwourth to choose between the two worlds he loves.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E5 Pride and Prejudice Buck guides the cavalry to a Sioux camp to release hostages. They find the Sweetwater store owner's wife, Sally, and daughter, Jennifer, who the Sioux kidnapped years earlier. However, their reunion is not a happy one as complications arise.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E6 The Littlest Cowboy Ike struggles with his handicap and is bitter after being beaten by men who take advantage of him. But, when he meets Arthur, a terminally ill boy, his outlook begins to change. Despite his circumstances, Arthur has an undeniable lust for life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E13 The Young Englishman Lucas and Mark discover a young calf is missing and traces it to the nearby Ashford Ranch run by an Englishman. When Lucas accuses foreman Norv Waggoner of cattle rustling to build up his own herd, Norv plans retaliation.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E14 The Gaucho Curge Palmer is upset after Argentinian Juan Argentez bought a ranch he wanted. Palmer insults Argentez and his children, Nita and Manolo. Meanwhile, Manolo's anger over who is courting Nita gets him into trouble when her suitor is found dead.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E15 The Pet Lucas and Mark find out a pony they adopted after the owner was killed may have anthrax. Fears of an epidemic rise in town. Meanwhile, the killer comes to the McCain Ranch thinking that Lucas has valuable information.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E16 The Sheridan Story At the end of the Civil War, General Sheridan and his staff arrive at the McCain Ranch. Trouble begins when ex-confederate soldier and hired hand Frank Blandon confronts the general, who shot and wounded him in the war.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E2 Counterfeit Gun Cheyenne is guarding a gold shipment on a train. A gang robs the train and shoots a man dead. Before he passes away, the man names Cheyenne as the gang's leader. Cheyenne must clear his name.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E3 Road to Three Graves Cheyenne helps his friend Tuk deliver equipment across private property to a mine. However, they run into major problems when they encounter a detestable landowner who wants the equipment for himself.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Kid The Kid becomes part of a group of six Pony Express riders in the Old West based at the Sweetwater Station in the Nebraska territory. He meets station master, Teaspoon Hunter, and fellow riders, Buck, Jimmy, Ike, Cody and Lou.

programme.desc: S2 E1 Day of the Hunter A famous old frontiersman, with a reputation as the best rifleman around, challenges Luke to see who's really the best with a rifle.

programme.desc: S1 E15 The Pet Lucas and Mark find out a pony they adopted after the owner was killed may have anthrax. Fears of an epidemic rise in town. Meanwhile, the killer comes to the McCain Ranch thinking that Lucas has valuable information.

programme.desc: S1 E16 The Sheridan Story At the end of the Civil War, General Sheridan and his staff arrive at the McCain Ranch. Trouble begins when ex-confederate soldier and hired hand Frank Blandon confronts the general, who shot and wounded him in the war.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E2 Counterfeit Gun Cheyenne is guarding a gold shipment on a train. A gang robs the train and shoots a man dead. Before he passes away, the man names Cheyenne as the gang's leader. Cheyenne must clear his name.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E3 Road to Three Graves Cheyenne helps his friend Tuk deliver equipment across private property to a mine. However, they run into major problems when they encounter a detestable landowner who wants the equipment for himself.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E3 Home of the Brave After an Indian attack on settlers, Buck finds himself in the middle, torn between his loyalty to his Kiowa brother and his bond with Pony Express members. After the tribe captures Ike, Buck must prove that he is a real Indian at heart.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E4 Speak No Evil Ike witnesses a stagecoach massacre and turns the killer's leader over to the marshal. However, the gang kidnaps and threatens to kill one of the riders if Ike testifies. It is a race against time to serve justice and keep one of their own alive.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E15 A Case of Identity Aaron Wingate lost his wife and son in a river boat fire years ago. The boy was never found. Wingate hires two private detectives who come to North Fork and decide that Mark will fit the bill. Lucas must fight for custody.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E16 The Visitor A pretty young widow named Ann Dodd passes through North Fork on her way to claim her inheritance. She and Lucas are immediately attracted to each other, but danger awaits as other heirs try to take Ann's life to get the inheritance for themselves.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Storm Riders The hired hand of a wealthy landowner ambushes and injures Cheyenne while he drives a herd of horses for a local rancher, on what he thought was open territory. As his boss nurses him back to health, Cheyenne gets more than he bargained for.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E12 The Battle of Stone Corral When bandits rob a train and gun down a pursuing marshal, they spark one of the largest manhunts in California history. After taking shelter behind the crumbling walls of Stone Corral, they make their final stand against a hail of gunfire.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Bandit Queen Once a feared gunfighter and sheriff, the legendary Bat Masterson is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story of Pearl Hart, the first woman to rob a stagecoach in the Old West. Masterson tracks down Pearl’s partner-in-crime, Joe Boot, who shares every daring and surprising detail from his wild days with the notorious “Bandit Queen.” In a time when outlaws and gunslingers captured the fascination of the American public, Pearl Hart was living proof that in the Wild West a woman could be just as infamous as a man.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E5 Kit Carson: The Greatest Scout in the West As a fur trapper, hunter, scout, and explorer, Kit Carson is an irresistible subject for reporters and novelists, and his incredible adventures make him a mythic figure in his own lifetime. Yet fame is the last thing on Carson's mind in 1849. All he wants to do is settle down to a quiet life with his wife on the family ranch, but once again fate comes calling. When settler Ann White is captured by an Apache raiding party, the Army seeks out Carson to help track the warriors and rescue Mrs. White, whose husband was killed in the raid. Although known to be the best tracker in the history of the Western Frontier, Carson admits this is the most difficult trail he has ever followed. He leads the military on a desperate chase, tracking the Apache through 200 miles of treacherous western wilderness. When they finally catch up with the Apache, the aftermath leaves Carson haunted for the rest of his days.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E7 Blood Money The Kid captures a murder suspect and brings him back to town. However, suspicions arise when the man hangs himself while in the custody of a corrupt marshal. The riders and family of the dead man are determined to find out the truth.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E8 Requiem for a Hero Cody meets his Western idol, Hezekiah Horn, a writer who is disgusted with the violence of the Indian police and the development of the West. Meanwhile, an unfortunate chain of events creates tragedy for Horn and his son.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E17 The Retired Gun Wes Carney, a famous gunfighter, and his new wife Clair move to North Fork. They open a store and settle down. However, three outlaws come to town to challenge him. Carney refuses and they ransack his store, forcing him to put his gunbelt back on.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E18 The Photographer Abel Goss is doing a portrait of Mark standing on a North Fork street. Suddenly he sees Colonel Whiteside and his sidekick, Jamison. When he recognizes them as the cruel men who tortured him in a Civil War prison camp, problems soon arise.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E19 Shivaree A young couple traveling to Yuma to get married come across Aaron Pelser's wagon train. Pelser and his group take things too far by forcing them to marry in North Fork, which is not the friendly spirit for a shivaree. Lucas steps in to help.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E20 The Deadeye Kid After witnessing a murder, 16 year-old Donnel O'Mahoney panics and comes to the McCain Ranch. A posse is on the hunt for the young man, believing he commited the crime. Mark befriends and hides O'Mahoney, who is traveling west from New York.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E4 Two Trails to Santa Fe Cheyenne helps an Apache woman escape torture from her tribe. He transports her to Santa Fe. However, angry Apaches retaliate and attack a settlement. The pair also encounters gold-hungry prospectors along the way.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E5 Savage Breed Cheyenne is guiding a buffalo hunting party that Marshal Lestrade is leading. Lestrade's daughter Lily and Senator Carr are in the group. Cheyenne finds a herd, but a mysterious gunshot sends the buffalo on a stampede. Cheyenne is suspicious.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E3 Home of the Brave After an Indian attack on settlers, Buck finds himself in the middle, torn between his loyalty to his Kiowa brother and his bond with Pony Express members. After the tribe captures Ike, Buck must prove that he is a real Indian at heart.

programme.desc: S5 E4 Two Trails to Santa Fe Cheyenne helps an Apache woman escape torture from her tribe. He transports her to Santa Fe. However, angry Apaches retaliate and attack a settlement. The pair also encounters gold-hungry prospectors along the way.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E5 Savage Breed Cheyenne is guiding a buffalo hunting party that Marshal Lestrade is leading. Lestrade's daughter Lily and Senator Carr are in the group. Cheyenne finds a herd, but a mysterious gunshot sends the buffalo on a stampede. Cheyenne is suspicious.

programme.title: Far Haven
programme.desc: In 1887, Hunter Braddock moves back to Far Haven, Arizona to start over with his two young children, but when his father-in-law is brutally attacked he must take on the corrupt forces strangling the town in order to protect what he loves most.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E17 Hero While hunting, Colly Vane encounters a dangerous outlaw, The Domino Kid, who forces Vane to shoot him. When he brings the body back to town, it's discovered he was shot in the back. Instead of being a hero, Vane faces danger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E18 The Horse Traders Kansas Sawyer is Lucas' friend who was cheated in a horse-trading deal. Lucas investigates Colonel Bourbon's operation and discovers his illegal process. He also learns that the horse Sawyer bought was stolen and is being sought after by outlaws.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Dalton Gang Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story behind the most brazen bank robbery of the Old West. Masterson tracks down the sole survivor of the Dalton Gang, who relives the horrible day when they attempted to rob two banks at the same time. The youngest of the Dalton brothers, Emmett Dalton describes how the gang was gunned down as they tried to make their getaway. Despite numerous gunshot wounds, Emmett lived to serve his time in prison and renounce his life of crime.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Great Train Robbery Bat Masterson, former gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the story behind one of the country’s greatest train robberies. Although Butch and Sundance are long gone, Masterson tracks down Sundance’s former girlfriend, Etta Place, to draw out more details. To pull off the audacious robbery, they used official Union Pacific lanterns to signal the train and fool the engineer into believing a bridge was out. As Etta reluctantly relives the events of the robbery and its aftermath, it’s obvious that she is still smitten by Sundance after all of these years.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S2 E8 William Sublette: King of the Fur Trade In his quest to become king of the fur trade, William Sublette revolutionizes the industry and puts his life on the line in the process. But he may risk too much when he rushes to save his comrades in the largest battle of the mountain man era.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E9 Bad Company Jimmy accidentally kills an innocent woman during a gunfight. Full of guilt, he goes to a lawless town, thinking that is where he should reside. The riders go after him to convince him that he doesn't belong there.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E11 The Play's the Thing Cody joins a troupe of traveling actors, unaware that the group's members are Confederates who are plotting to assassinate U.S. General Fremont. When the riders discover the truth, they ride to Fort Laramie to save Fremont from getting murdered.
